main event: A radar detection of a fast-moving, white starlike object over the Atlantic Ocean, near the coast of Greece.
interesting points: The object was observed moving very fast from south-southwest to north-northeast, disappearing from view in about 4 minutes.
The object was initially thought to be a rocket or missile, but radar confirmation was received.
The report notes that the object's behavior and characteristics were not typical of a known rocket or missile, leading to the consideration that it may have been a UFO.
The sighting was reported by a Greek civilian and confirmed by radar, adding credibility to the observation.
The report was part of Project 10073, a government program investigating unidentified aerial phenomena.
location: Atlantic Ocean, near the coast of Greece
